HOW IT WORKS

01

Submit

Describe your problem + pay $20. The price is the filter.

02

Review

Each day, I review submissions and pick two: one from the top, one at random.

03

Work

Up to an hour of focused work on camera. No face ‚Äî just the work.

04

Deliver

You get the YouTube link + a written report with findings.

05

Next Steps

You'll get one of three outcomes. If it's a fit, I'll invite you to go deeper on my terms.

WHY THIS WORKS

01

Friction Is the Filter

$20 keeps the queue serious and funds production. If it doesn't filter, it doesn't work.

02

Public Work, Real Proof

Sessions are recorded and published. Judge the thinking, not the credentials.

One hour of undivided attention. No meetings. No Slack.

04

You leave with either a fix, a roadmap, or a referral.

EXAMPLES FROM THE QUEUE

Representative examples of the kinds of problems the queue is built for. Names anonymized.

Operations

"Our inventory counts never match."

Two systems were rounding differently. Align the rules, fix the feed, move on.

Outcome: Diagnosis + fix

Technical

"Our app crashes every Tuesday."

Weekly cron job collided with peak traffic. Move it to 3 AM and the problem disappears.

Outcome: Root cause + fix

Strategy

"Build it or buy it?"

Mapped hidden costs and timing risk. Recommendation: buy now, migrate later.

Outcome: Decision framework

Marketing

"Signups stalled."

Walked the funnel live. Fixed the top three friction points during the session.

Outcome: Funnel fixes + roadmap

WHO IS FOGSIFT

Christopher Tavolazzi

Expert Researcher

Software developer. Former realtor, brewery tour guide, journalist, author, and Eagle Scout. He's lived in a van across America's national parks and played music on three continents. Whatever you're stuck on, he can probably find someone who knows how to fix it. If it's a fit, he'll invite you to go deeper on his terms.

WHAT HAPPENS AFTER

"Let's go deeper."

We see something real. If it's a fit, I'll invite you to work together on my terms.

"I know people."

This isn't my lane, but I can point you to someone who can help.

"This is sick."

This would be cool if somebody did it. You should. Here's a path forward.

COMMON CONCERNS

"What if you can't solve it?"

Then you still get the video + report, plus a narrower problem statement or referral.

"Is my problem too big?"

One hour is for momentum. You'll leave with clarity and next steps, even if the full fix takes longer.

"Why charge $20?"

It filters noise, funds production, and keeps it open to anyone who can get a job at McDonald's. If it doesn't sting, it doesn't filter.

"Will my problem be public?"

Public by default. Request anonymization at submission time.
